eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Shakespeare Club
eventData.description:
The Yale Shakespeare Club seeks to foster a love of Shakespeare’s works. Both long-time bardolators and Shakespeare novices are welcome to explore together the “infinite variety” of Shakespeare through many media, such as reading, film, scholarship, and performance. We also facilitate frequent, low-stress Shakespeare performances on campus for anyone to enjoy or perform—the best way to fall in love with the bard.

Come read some Shakespeare, watch some clips, have a nerdy discussion, and learn about the Yale Shakespeare Club!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Chi Alpha Christian Fellowship
eventData.description:
Yale Chi Alpha is a Christian community on campus. We have weekly large group meetings we call TNL (Tuesday Night Live), weekly Core Groups, a Fall Retreat, and other fun things that happen throughout the semester. Our three core values are that students would have real devotion, real community, and real responsibility.

Meet the students within Chi Alpha! Not only will you get to meet our Core Group leaders, but some of the first years within our group will be there too as well as some of the Chi Alpha staff members. Ask any questions you want, hangout, and maybe even play some games with our students!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Yale Adventist Campus Fellowship
eventData.description:
We are a Seventh-day Adventist Christian Student Organization that serves as an affinity group for Seventh-day Adventist students both at Yale and in the New Haven Area. We organize worship and ministry efforts with local congregations, network with Adventist students around the world, coordinate community service projects in the New Haven Area, and work with other campus organizations, religious and secular, on matters of justice.

Friday Evening Bible Study! Join us as we read through the book of Judges and discuss what we can learn from the example of Israel’s earliest days. No prior biblical knowledge necessary. We will also have time for prayer, testimonies, as well as plenty of time for you to meet other Adventists on campus.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Every Vote Counts
eventData.description:
Every Vote Counts (EVC) is a nonpartisan voter advocacy group committed to making voting more accessible and more representative. EVC engages with on-campus and off-campus organizations to expand voter turnout and educate community members on the importance of voting. Founded in 2016 at Yale following disappointing youth voter turnout in the presidential election, EVC has since expanded to over fifty campuses nationwide, forming a national network of college students dedicated to strengthening our democracy.

Drop in to chat with us about our organization, our work to make voting more accessible in Connecticut (a state with surprisingly archaic election laws), or about voter suppression politics and election reform in the US in general!

eventData.headline: Federalist Party
eventData.description: We are one of the seven political parties inside of the Yale Political Union. Join our meet and greet with our members.

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: First Years in Support of New Haven
eventData.description:
First-Years in Support of New Haven is an academic-year program for Yale College first-years to sustainably connect and consciously engage with the vibrant New Haven community. Our aim is to learn from the leadership and experience of community partners who dedicate their professional and personal lives to our shared city. We strive to foster open conversations about the changing New Haven/Yale relationship and engage in sustainable service that will continue throughout each student's time in New Haven.

Welcome to Yale! FIS-NH is hosting an event to get to know you, introduce you to New Haven, and have all your Yale questions answered. Hope to see you then!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: The Yale Globalist
eventData.description:
The Globalist is Yale's premier undergraduate international affairs magazine.

Are you interested in journalism or international affairs, or just want to try out something new next year? Hear from current Glo members about what we do and ask any questions you may have!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Something Extra
eventData.description: Join Something Extra--Yale University's Premier All-Women's A Cappella Group, Since 1977--on zoom for an introduction to a cappella at Yale, fun activities with some of the group's members, and an overall great time!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: Saint Thomas More Catholic Chapel
eventData.description:
Saint Thomas More, the Catholic Chapel & Center at Yale University is more than a Chapel or student center. With lots of opportunities for prayerful contemplation, comfortable study spaces, fun events, supportive chaplains and an engaging Catholic community of Yale undergraduates, graduates, faculty and staff, STM is both a place that will allow you many chances to grow in your faith and a space you can call home.

Rosary, Games, and Q&A! Please join current Catholic students at Yale and meet some prospective students while we pray a Rosary, play some fun games, and engage in a Q&A! So excited to see you there. All are welcome!

eventType.name: Student Groups
eventType.description: Opportunities to get to know student groups and resources on campus!

eventData.headline: William F. Buckley, Jr. Program at Yale
eventData.description:
The William F. Buckley Jr. Program is an organization dedicated to promoting intellectual diversity and open political discussion at Yale.  We host lectures, dinner seminars, Firing Line Debates, and an annual conference. Our over three-hundred Buckley fellows have a wide range of political beliefs, but they all stand united against the formation of a liberal-only echo chamber on campus. By providing Yale students with a forum to engage meaningfully with serious conservative thought, the Buckley Program forwards its mission of a more open and more representative political atmosphere. Especially at a university, where the mission is the cultivation and creation of new knowledge, Buckley fellows believe that all perspectives, including those of the right, must be heard and examined in good faith. You can learn more about the program and how to become a fellow on our website buckleyprogram.com.

Buckley student President Jasper Boers '22 and board members Mathis Bitton '23 and Libby Snowden '24 will meet to discuss the state of the school, political discourse on campus, and opportunities to get involved with the Buckley Program.
